item.description:
An overall moderate hike with some portions of modestly high difficulty covering 4.25 miles in a loop lasting about 3.5 hours. The hike is at Chatfield Hollow State Park. Some climbs, some views, some marsh and pond, some caves too! This is the first time we are offering this hike.

We'll meet at 10 AM at the parking area in Chatfield Hollow State Park just inside the park entrance (see park hiking map below). There should also be parking for about 6 cars on the south side of Rt. 80.

Remember to bring 1 - 2 Qts. water and a trail snack for some pep. A headlamp may be useful for one or two of the caves but not needed. A daypack to hold water and food is strongly recommended to free hands for occasional scrambles up and down. This is a popular park so parking may be limited.

In pre-Colonial times, Indians frequented the valley in considerable numbers for purposes of fishing and hunting. Many artifacts found in the vicinity of Indian Council Caves indicated that Native Americans sought refuge in the jagged ledges and held tribal gatherings amid the rock recesses and overhangs. An Indian trail paralleled the brook, winding through the trees and along what is now the park road.

Cliffs may not be suitable for children. Dogs on a leash are permitted per park regulations but some of the trail is rugged and may not be suitable.

Approximate location/directions to parking area (eastern entrance near 449 Route 80, Killingworth, CT):
http://mapq.st/VYD15b
[lat=41.365039, long=-72.584251]

Hiking map:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?a=2716&q=325182&depNav_GID=1650

Topographic map of the area centered roughly on the trailhead on Rte. 80.
http://www.trails.com/topo.aspx?panerror=true&z=18&e=701661.0&n=4582500.0&s=50&size=s&style=drgsr

More information on Chatfield Hollow State Park:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?a=2716&q=325182&depNav_GID=1650

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Kevin's old dark green Dodge Caravan, CT plates. Meet at hike location.
